QueryText: Asked about doses of fertilizer for 10 years old Mangosteen
KccAns: Suggested to apply 1 Kg lime per plant per year at two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Apply 75 Kg organic manure per plant per year.  Apply 2.1 Kg Urea, 4 Kg Rajphos and 5 Kg Potash per plant per year. 10 days gap should be given between organic manure and chemical fertilizer application.

QueryText: Asked about doses of fertilizer for 5 years old nutmeg plant
KccAns:
Suggested to apply lime @ 500g per plant at two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Apply organic manure at 10 Kg per plant per year.
Apply 110g Urea, 250g Rajphos and 210g Potash per plant during April- june. Apply 110g Urea, 250g Rajphos and 210g Potash per plant during September-October.

QueryText: Asked management of dieback disease of nutmeg
KccAns: Recommended to prun the diseased twigs 2-3 inches below the affected portion. Paste the pruned twigs with Copper oxychloride 50 WP (10 gram/litre of water) followed by spraying of Copper oxychloride 50 WP (2 gram/litre of water) on infected nutmeg tree.

QueryText: Asked about management of bud rot disease in Arecanut
KccAns:
Suggested to remove and destroy dead palms. When the spindle leaf starts withering, remove and destroy all affected tissues of the spindle along with healthy tissues and apply Bordeaux paste and protect it by covering with a polythene cover or a mud pot.
Drench the spindle leaf base and the base of the other leaves with Metalaxyl + Mancozeb 80 WP (2 gram/litre of water) in 2 weeks interval especially during monsoon season. Root feed with Potassium phosphonate 50 SC @ 6ml in 100 ml of water.

QueryText: Asked about organic manure application for coconut
KccAns:
Suggested to apply 25 kg organic manure ( include well rotten cowdung or compost and 2-3 kg neem cake ) along with chemical fertilizers.
Apply 50 kg organic manure if organic cultivation is practiced.

QueryText: Asked about Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (Premium to be paid for banana)
KccAns:
Suggested that Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) scheme provide insurance coverage and financial support to the farmers in the event of failure of any of the notified crop as a result of natural calamities, pests and diseases.
Apply online through  CSC or Akshaya centre.
For 0.16 ha banana the premium for Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana is 1140  for an insured sum of 48000.

QueryText: Asked about Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
KccAns:
Suggested that Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) scheme provide insurance coverage and financial support to the farmers in the event of failure of any of the notified crop as a result of natural calamities, pests and diseases.
Apply online through  CSC or Akshaya centre.

QueryText: Asked about query related to Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
KccAns:
Suggested that Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana is a cental sector scheme that provide insurance coverage and financial support to the farmers in the event of failure of any of the notified crops as a result of natural calamities, pests and diseases. PMFBY can be enrolled  through CSCs or Akshaya centre. Documents required are phone number, Aadhaar number, land possession certificate, land right document, sowing certificate or self declaration of intent to sow the proposed crop, and the copy of Bank Pass Book. 
Start of enrolment of farmers for the season(as per crop calendar) is from 1st October. For more details contact Agriculture insurance company of India - 1800 425 7064.

QueryText: Asked about varieties of rubber
KccAns:
Suggested that

PB 260: Released from Prang Besar Estate, Malaysia. Parentage Tjir 1 x Gl 1A high yielding clone having good secondary characters.  On farm evaluation(1631 kg/ha/yr)

RRII 105: Released from Rubber Research Institute of India. Parentage Tjir 1 x Gl 1. Clone coming under Category I. Drought tolerant. Good branching with strong union. The highest yielding clone showing stability in yield. TPD On farm evaluation(2210 kg/ha/yr)

RRII 414: Released from Rubber Research Institute of India. Parentage RRII 105 X RRIC 100. Clone coming under Category 1. A high yielding clone with vigorous growth and early tappability. Wood yield in terms of bole volume is high. Incidence of pink disease and abnormal leaf fall are moderate while the clone is relatively tolerant to Corynespora

RRII 417: Released from Rubber Research Institute of India. Parentage RRII 105 x RRIC 100. Clone coming under Category I. A vigorous and high yielding clone with above average tolerance to wind. Quality of wood is good in terms of high density and better processability. Incidence of abnormal leaf fall is low to moderate. Moderately susceptible to Corynespora.

RRII 422: Released from Rubber Research Institute of India. Parentage RRII 105 X RRIC 100. Clone coming under Category I. A clone with vigorous growth and high yield. Incidence of Pink disease is low. Trees are slightly short in stature with high leaf retention in immature phase.

RRII 430: Released from Rubber Research Institute of India. Parentage RRII 105 x RRIC 100. Clone coming under Category I. A high yielding and drought tolerant clone. This clone is vigorous in growth leading to early tappability. Incidence of abnormal leaf fall, pink disease and Corynespora leaf disease are low.
Contact  RRII, phone, 0481 235 3311

KccAns: Suggested that copra have 5 % GST

QueryText: Asked about nutrient management in mangosteen
KccAns:
Suggested to apply 1 kg urea, 2 kg rajphos and 2.5 kg potash per plant in May- June. Apply the same dose in Sept- Oct.
Apply 1 kg lime per plant 2 weeks before fertilizer application. Apply 75 kg organic manure per plant in a year.

QueryText: Asked about nutrient management in Mango
KccAns: It is suggested to apply  in Aug-September and the dosage is 542 gram urea, 999 gram rock phosphate, 626 gram Muriate of Potash respectively per plant. Lime or dolomite has to be applied in acid soils two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Organic manure @ 75 kg/plant is recommended every year.

QueryText: Induction of flowering and improvement of yield in adult mango tree
KccAns: Dilute Cultar 10ml per 10L of water and drench soil at about 60cm away from tree trunk, soil shoud be wet at the time of application

QueryText: Asked about cultivation of vetiver.

QueryText: Asked about second dose of fertilizer for coconut
KccAns: Responded that the second dose has to be applied in September-October and the dosage is 180 gram Urea, 750 gram Factomphos and 1 kilogram Muriate of Potash.

QueryText: Asked about no fruit setting in papaya plant
KccAns: Suggested that the papaya plants are dioecious. Male and female flowers are present on different plants. The not fruit setting papaya may be male one. Confirm it by contacting nearby krishibhavan.

QueryText: Asked about emergence of seedling from banana bunch
KccAns: Suggested to inform nearby Krishibhavn

QueryText: Asked about management of cashew stem and root borer
KccAns:
Recommended to mechanically remove various stages of pest (grubs and pupae) by carefully chiseling the bark in the infected trees.
Swab the chiseled area with Chlorpyrifos 20 EC (10 ml/litre of water) and drench Chlorpyriphos 20 EC (2 ml/litre of water) solution into the soil near the root zone to minimize reinfestation by the pest.
Swab the trunk region (up to 1 m height from the ground level) and exposed roots, with a suspension of coal tar and kerosene (1:2 ratio) or neem oil (50 ml/litre of water) twice a year during March - April and November-December as prophylatic measure.

QueryText: Asked about budding in avocado
KccAns: Suggested to contact KVK kozhikode, Ph: 0496 266 6041

QueryText: Asked about doses of fertilizer for mangosteen
KccAns: Suggested to apply lime at 1 Kg per plant per year at two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Apply farm yard manure at 75 Kg per plant per year. Apply 2.1 Kg Urea, 4 Kg Rajphos and 5 Kg Potash per plant per year.

QueryText: Asked about management of flower dropping in mangosteen
KccAns:
Suggested to apply lime at 1 Kg per plant per year at two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Apply farm yard manure at 75 Kg per plant per year. Apply 2.1 Kg Urea, 4 Kg Rajphos and 5 Kg Potash per plant per year.
Apply borax at 100g per plant.

QueryText: Asked about management of bud rot disease in coconut
KccAns:
Recommended to clean the crown before monsoon and apply Bordeaux paste. Cover the applied part with a mud pot inverted to avoid contact with water. Spray Bordeaux mixture (1%) on the crown of the neighbouring palms as a prophylatic measure.
Burn all diseased tissues removed from the palm. Pouring Mancozeb solution (5 gram /300 ml of water) coupled with placing of small perforated sachets (2 no) containing 3-4 gram Mancozeb 75 WP in the inner most leaf axils is found to be effective. 
As a prophylactic measure, formulations of biocontrol agents like Trichoderma harzianum and Pseudomonas flourescens can also be applied on the crown.

KccAns: Suggested to spray neem oil garlic emulsion (20ml neem oil + 20g garlic + 5g bar soap + 1 litre water) or spray azadirachtin @ 5 ml per litre water or spray Verticillium @ 20g per litre water.

QueryText: Asked about methods to induce flowering in mango tree
KccAns: Suggested to apply Paclobutrazol @ 5 gram/10 litre of water for non-bearing trees as soil drenching 60 cm away from tree trunk. It is done during first fortnight of September and will induce flowering and fruit set yield during off years. Irrigate the trees after the application.

QueryText: Asked about nutrient management in coconut
KccAns: Recommended to apply Organic manure @ 25 kg/plant  every year. Open the coconut basin and apply Lime @ 1 kg has to be applied in acid soils two weeks before of fertilizer application. The first split has to be applied in April-June. The dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj  phos, 1  kg Potash per palm respectively. The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj phos, 1kg Potash per palm respectively.

QueryText: Asked doses of fertilizer for coconut
KccAns: Suggested to apply Lime @ 1 kg soils two weeks ahead of fertilizer application.The first split has to be applied in April-June. the dosage is 1400g 18:9:18 fertilizer and 500g Potash per plant respectively.  The second dose has to be applied in September-October and the dosage is 1400g 18:9:18 fertilizer and 500g Potash per plant respectively. Apply Organic manure @ 25 kg/plant  every year.

QueryText: Asked about Nutrient management in mature Coconut
KccAns: Recommended to apply Organic manure @ 25 kg/plant  every year. Open the coconut basin and apply Lime @ 1 kg has to be applied in acid soils two weeks before of fertilizer application. The first split has to be applied in April-June. The dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj  phos, 1  kg Potash per palm respectively. The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj phos, 1 kg Potash per palm respectively. Apply 100 gram borax per palm after each fertilizer application

QueryText: Asked about doses of fertilizer for nendran banana
KccAns:
Recommended to apply lime @ 1 Kg per plant at two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Apply organic manure @ 10 Kg per plant at planting time. 
Apply 210g Urea, 320g Rajphos and 250g Potash per plant at two months after planting. (Or apply 320g 18:18:18 fertilizer, 90g Urea and 160 g Potash per plant at two months after planting)
Apply 210g Urea, 320g Rajphos and 250 Potash per plant four moths after planting.  (Or apply 320g 18:18:18 fertilizer, 90g Urea and 160 g Potash per plant at four months after planting).
Apply the fertilizer 60-75 cm around the plant. Irrigate immediately after manuring.

QueryText: Asked about doses of fertilizer for nendran banana
KccAns:
Recommended to apply lime @ 1 Kg per banana plant in soils two weeks before of fertilizer application. Apply organic manure @ 10 kg per plant is at planting time.
The first split has to be applied in one month after planting. The dosage is 90 gram urea, 360 gram raj phos, 100 gram Potash respectively per plant.
The second dose has to be applied in two month after planting. The dosage is 70 gram urea, 280 gram raj phos, 100 gram potash respectively per plant.
The fertilizer dose at 3rd, 4th, 5th months are same and the dosage is 70 gram urea, 100 gram Muriate of Potash respectively each time.
The sixth dose has to be applied at just after complete bunch emergence. The fertilizer dose is 70 gram urea.
Apply the fertilizer 60-75 cm around the plant. Irrigate immediately after manuring.

KccAns: First fertilizer requirement in Coloccassia is 3g Urea,4g Rajphos and 3g Muriate of potash per plant one week after sprouting

QueryText: Asked about management of Foot rot in Amorphophallus
KccAns: Remove and burn the infected materials. Improve drainage conditions. Incorporate organic amendments like neem cake. Drench the soil with Carbendazim 50 WP 2 gram/litre of water.

QueryText: Planting of nendran banana suckers
KccAns: Pits of size of 50 cm x 50 cm x 50 cm are made for planting. The pits are filled with top soil and organic manure @ 10 kg/pit.The suckers are planted upright in the centre of pits with 5 cm pseudostem remaining above soil level.

QueryText: Asked about management of pod bug in vegetable peas
KccAns: Suggested to spray Chlorantraniliprole 18.5 SC 3ml in 10 litres of water for management of pod bug in peas

QueryText: Asked about white pipe in banana
KccAns: Responded for banana white pipe symptom, to apply lime at 1 kilogram per banana and after 2 weeks add Borax 10 gram per plant in the soil or spray 2 gram mixed in 1 litre of water.

QueryText: Asked about management of banana pseudostem weevil
KccAns: Responded for management of banana pseudostem weevil, to cut 60 cm long pseudostem of harvested banana plant and cut it longitudinally and keep it in the centre of field covered in the evening. Kill the weevils by hand in the morning.

QueryText: Asked about management of pseudostem weevil in banana
KccAns:
Recommended to regularly remove dried hanging leaves of the plant. Place 50 gram neem cake powder in the leaf axils on the 5th, 6th and 7th months. 
Mix 3 ml neem oil in 1 litre mud slurry and swab around the pseudostem.
Set traps using pseudostem approximatetly 0.5 m length, split lengthwise and lay in the field. Collect weevils from trap and destroy it.
Spray Beauveria bassiana or Metarhizium anisopliae @ 20g per litre water on pseudostem and pseudostem traps. Fill the leaf axil with Beauveria bassiana or Metarhizium anisopliae @ 20g per litre water. 
Spray Chlorpyrifos 20 EC @ 1.5 ml per litre of water with nozzle directed to the leaf axils and bore holes.

QueryText: Asked about management of collar rot in chilli
KccAns: Suggested to drench copper oxy chloride 2 gram in one litre of water.

QueryText: Nutrient management in Acid lime sixth year and above
KccAns: 30 Kg Organic manure ,1300g Urea , Rajphos 1Kg and Potash 498 g per plant per year,  apply fertilizers in two equal splits, once during May June and second during September - October. Two weeks prior to fertilizer application during May – June apply 500 g lime per plant.

QueryText: Asked about management of Rhinoceros Beetle
KccAns:
Recommended to provide field sanitation to prevent breeding of beetles. Hook out the beetle from the attacked palms using beetle hook. As a prophylactic measure, application of 250 gram neem cake or marotti (Hydnocarpus wightina) cake mixed with equal volume of sand in the innermost 2-3 leaf axils. This treatment is to be done twice, ie, during April-May before the onset of south-west monsoon and during September-October after the south-west monsoon. Naphthalene balls 12.0 gram (approx. 4 nos.) can be put in the innermost 2 leaf axils adjacent to spindle leaf and covered with fine sand, once in 45 days.  Crown cleaning followed by the application of 20 gram Ferterra 0.4 G mixed with 200 gram sand in the innermost 2-3 leaf axils. The application has to be done thrice during January, May and September.
Spray Metarrhizium anisopliae (250 ml Metarrizhium culture + 750 ml water) in manure pits and other breeding sites of the beetle or incorporate  Clerodendron infortunatum @ 10 % w/w basis in the cowdung and manure pits.

QueryText: Asked about Pseudomonas Application in banana
KccAns: Suggested to do sucker treatment with Pseudomonas fluorescens @ 20 gram per litre of water + soil drenching of  Pseudomonas fluorescens @ 20 gram per litre of water.

QueryText: Asked about management of red palm weevil in coconut
KccAns:
Recommended to practice clean cultivation by cutting and removing palms already damaged and the decaying stumps in the garden. Avoid making steps or any other injury on the tree trunks to reduce the loci of infestation.
As a prophylactic measure, clean the crown and apply 250 gram neem cake mixed with equal volume of sand in the innermost 2-3 leaf axils. Naphthalene balls 12.0 gram (approx. 4 nos.) in the innermost 2 leaf axils and covered with fine sand, once in 45 days.
Observe for boreholes in attacked palms and seal all except the top most one. Through the top most hole, imidachloprid (1ml/ litre of water) @ 1-2 litre per palm, using a funnel.

QueryText: Asked about management of pseudostem weevil in banana
KccAns:
Recommended to remove severly affected plants. Regularly remove dried hanging leaves of the plant. Observe strict field sanitation. Uproot severly affected plants and burn or destroy using kerosene. Place 50 gram neem cake powder or bar soap in the leaf axils on the 5th and 7th month.
Cut pseudo stem into small pieces in lengths of up to 60 cm and split each along its length. The split pseudo stem are placed in the soil in the way that the cut portion faces the ground. The recommended number is 30 to 40 numbers (split traps) per acre.
The open cut side of the above pseudostem trap can be sprayed with solution of Beauveria bassiana  (5 gram /liter). The weevil gets infected by the fungal spores when it enters the pseudostem trap. This kills the insects within 72 hours.
n case of severe attack, spray or Quinalphos 25 EC (1.5 ml/litre of water) with nozzle directed to the leaf axils and bore holes.

QueryText: Asked about management of bacterial wilt in ginger
KccAns: Suggested to spray drench the beds with Bordeaux mixture (1 %).

QueryText: Asked about fertilizer requirement in Nutmeg Third year
KccAns: Lime or dolomite has to be applied in acid soils two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Organic manure @ 20 kg/plant is recommended in every year. The first split has to be applied in May-June. The urea, rock phosphate, Muriate of Potash needed at this time is 66 gram, 150 gram, 126 gram respectively per plant. The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 63 gram urea, 150 gram rock phosphate, 82 gram Muriate of Potash respectively per plant.

QueryText: Asked about fertilizer requirement in Nutmeg fifth year
KccAns: Lime or dolomite has to be applied in acid soils two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Organic manure @ 30 kg/plant is recommended in every year. The first split has to be applied in May-June. The urea, rock phosphate, Muriate of Potash needed at this time is 110 gram, 250 gram, 210 gram respectively per plant. The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 105 gram urea, 250 gram rock phosphate, 205 gram Muriate of Potash respectively per plant(Fifth year).

QueryText: Asked about management of fruit rot disease in nutmeg
KccAns: Suggested to spray copper oxychloride @ 2g per litre water.

QueryText: Asked about mangement of pandanus plant
KccAns: Suggested to spray Glufosinate ammonium @ 6g per litre water on pandanus plant.

QueryText: Asked about management of pseudostem weevil in banana
KccAns:
Recommended to remove affected plants along with the rhizome in full and destroy them by burning the life stages of the insect using kerosene or by burying the material in deep pits in soil. Regularly remove dried hanging leaves of the plant. Observe strict field sanitation.
 Place 50 gram neem cake powder or bar soap in the leaf axils on the 5th and 7th month. 
Mix 3 ml neem oil in 1 litre mud slurry and swab around the pseudostem.
Apply neem cake in planting pits. Spray Beauveria bassiana @ 20g per litre water on pseudostem and pseudostem traps. Fill the leaf axil with Beauveria bassiana @ 20g per litre water. 
Pseudostem trap: Cut pseudo stem into small pieces in lengths of up to 60 cm and split each along its length. The split pseudo stem are placed in the soil in the way that the cut portion faces the ground. The recommended number is 30 to 40 numbers (split traps) per acre.
In case of severe attack, spray  Chlorpyrifos 25 EC (1.5 ml/litre of water) with nozzle directed to the leaf axils and bore holes.

QueryText: Askled about management of leaf eating caterpillar i ngarcinia
KccAns:
Suggested to spray neem oil garlic emulsion (20g garlic+20ml neem oil+5g bar soap+ 1 litre water) to the leaves.
Or spray azadirachtin @ 5ml per litre water
Or spray Beauveria @ 20g per litre water

QueryText: Asked about application of lime to nutmeg plant
KccAns: Suggested that application of lime reduces the soil acidicity. So apply lime @ 750g per plant per year at 2 weeks ahead of fertilizer application.

QueryText: Asked about Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
KccAns:
Suggested to enrol PMFBY through CSC or Akshaya centre via. https://pmfby.gov.in/. Documents required are aadhar card, phone number, bank pass book, land right document, land possession certificate, sowing certificate or self declaration of intent to sow the proposed crop.
Suggested that Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana provides insurance coverage and financial support to the farmers in the event of failure of any notified crop as a result of natural calamities, pests and diseases. Enrollment for rabi crops starts in October 1.

QueryText: Asked about the crops which can be cultivate in shaded region
KccAns: Suggested that crops such as ginger, turmeric, arrow root, colocasia etc. can be cultivate in shaded region.

QueryText: Asked about management of dieback disease of nutmeg
KccAns: Recommended to prun twigs 2-3 inches below the affected portion. Paste the pruned twigs with Copper oxychloride 50 WP @ 10 gram/litre of water followed by spraying of Copper oxychloride 50 WP @ 3 gram/litre of water on infected tree.

QueryText: Asked about no fruit set in coccinnia
KccAns: Suggested to contact krishibhavan

QueryText: Asked about nutrient management in coconut
KccAns: Recommended to apply Organic manure @ 25 kg/plant  every year. Open the coconut basin and apply Lime @ 1 kg has to be applied in acid soils two weeks before of fertilizer application.The first split has to be applied in April-June. The dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj  phos, 1  kg Potash per palm respectively. The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj phos, 1kg Potash per palm respectively.

QueryText: Asked about management of Bud Rot in Coconut
KccAns: Recommended to clean the crown in general during pre-monsoon period. Cut and remove the affected parts of the crown along with healthy tissues. Poure Mancozeb solution (5 gram /300 ml of water) coupled with placing of small perforated sachets (2 no) containing 3-4 gram Mancozeb 75 WP in the inner most leaf axils. Spray Bordeaux mixture (1%) on the crown of the neighbouring palms as a prophylatic measure.

QueryText: Asked about query related to Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
KccAns: Suggested that Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana is a cental sector scheme that provide insurance coverage and financial support to the farmers in the event of failure of any of the notified crops as a result of natural calamities, pests and diseases.

QueryText: Asked about management of leaf curling of chilli plants.
KccAns:
Recommended to spray neem oil-garlic emulsion (20 ml neem oil+ 20 gram garlic paste+ 5 gram bar soap dissolved / litre of water).
Or spray Azadirachtin at 5ml per litre water.
Or spray Verticillium lecanii @ 20g per litre water.

QueryText: Asked about management of white insect on bittergourd
KccAns: Suggested to spray Imidacloprid 17.8 SL @ 2-3 ml/10 litre of water

QueryText: Asked about not fruit setting in passion fruit
KccAns: Suggested to spray borax at 1g per litre water to the plants.

QueryText: Asked about planting of tissue culture banana
KccAns: Suggested to Prepare pits 15 days in advance of planting. Pit size IS 50 cm x 50 cm x 50 cm. spacing 2 m x 2 m   Fill the pits with topsoil and FYM 15-20 kg per plant per pit. Plant the tissue culture plants on the top of the page at the ground level. Remove the polythene cover completely before finding without damaging the roots. Planting may be done preferably during evening hours. Provide partial shade to plants to protect against sun scorching for about two weeks. Irrigate the crop daily during initial days of establishment.

QueryText: Asked about nutrient management in coconut
KccAns:
Recommended to apply organic manure @ 25 kg/plant  every year. Lime @ 1kg per palm has to be applied in acid soils two weeks before of fertilizer application.
The first split has to be applied in April-June. The dosage is 500 gram Urea, 750 gram Raj phos, 1000 gram Potash. .
The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj phos, 1000 gram Potash.

QueryText: Asked about management of drying of leaves in coconut
KccAns: Suggested to drench hexaconazole 1ml in one litre of water.

QueryText: Asked about management  of failure of unfolding of leaf
KccAns: Suggested to give foliar spray of borax 1 gram in one litre of water.

QueryText: Asked about banana sucker treatment
KccAns:
Suggested that Dip suckers in cowdung and ash slurry containing nem oil 5% to control rhizome weevil
or, psuedomonas 20g in 1 liter water. dry in shade.
